Prepared media can be stored at   for two weeks. Maintaining sterile culture, remove necessary volume as needed and pre-warm aliquot to   before use (unless otherwise noted).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":176,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":280,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"deqb6","text":"Flow buffer – Prepare fresh on the day of use by supplementing RPMI 1640 or appropriate base media (without phenol red) with 5% (vol/vol) dialyzed FBS. Alternatively, calcium free reagents can be used to reduce cell aggregation.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oakn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eaevm","text":"3D matrix embedment experiments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tge3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5e5uh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqpah","text":"Recombinant basement membrane master mix – Thaw growth factor reduced recombinant basement membrane (often referred to as its tradename Matrigel, rBM) at     and maintain   to avoid polymerization at room temperature. Spheroids are embedded in   rBM (in full media) and then plated onto a glass bottom dish. Note, the polymerization characteristics of rBM may change from lot to lot of Matrigel; as such, the concentration may need to be adjusted on a lot-specific basis. Additionally, cell secreted growth factors and cytokines will vary between lots of non-growth factor depleted Matrigel; growth factor reduced Matrigel leads to a more consistent composition (5).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":154,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":156,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":171,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":244,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3umb6","text":"Collagen I master mix – Keep stock collagen I (high concentration derived from rat tail) solution at   or   until ready for use.  , supplement stock collagen I with 10 % (vol/vol) PBS to a working concentration of  . Check pH of solution with pH strips and adjust pH to approximately  . Keeping working solution on ice until ready to use. Do not store dilute solution long-term.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":101,"length":1},{"key":8,"offset":106,"length":1},{"key":9,"offset":129,"length":1},{"key":10,"offset":214,"length":1},{"key":11,"offset":284,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9s0lj","text":"Collagenase/dispase cocktail: Suspend 100 mg of collagenase/dispase (C/D) in   of PBS or base media (without added growth factors or FBS) for a   stock solution. Importantly, calcium is an important factor for enzymatic stability and activity in this cocktail; therefore, in the case of PBS, calcium supplemented PBS is required. Pipette gently to thoroughly resuspend. Sterilize with a 0.2 μm filter. Make aliquots of stock at   per aliquot. Freeze at   until ready for use.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[{"key":12,"offset":77,"length":1},{"key":13,"offset":144,"length":1},{"key":14,"offset":428,"length":1},{"key":15,"offset":453,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dt2sc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jgoj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9la95","text":"Sample Preparation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34tgi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brq1d","text":"Guidelines: This section describes our approach to handling a variety of cell lines and patient samples in culture. Non-adherent and 2D conditions are respective to those particular and potentially uniquely appropriate to the experimental questions and cell treatments. 3D tumor spheroid formation is described in detail by using the example human NSCLC H1299 cell line. See Table 2 for parameters to consider for optimizing the 3D invasion assay procedure to other cell lines and systems.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5d4hg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s4r7","text":"ADDITIONAL NOTES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s13n","text":"Additional troubleshooting notes can be found in Table 5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8aae6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eik36","text":"Table 5 I Troubleshooting table","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2efqq","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1t17j","text":"      Step  Problem  Possible reason  Solution    18  Cells are unable to form spheroid  Low cell - cell adherence junction expression, low incubation time  Repeat centrifugation (step 19) and/or incubate for an additional 24 h.    33  Cells are shrinking; detaching from plate; swelling  Inadequate cell culture conditions on tabletop incubator  Ensure that the incubator is working at the appropriate temperature,   pressure, and CO2 level.    35  Poor imaging resolution  Scanning pixel size and/or line averaging amount is too low  Increase these imaging acquisition parameters to increase resolution.    37c  No fluorescent signal in the red channel  Laser intensity value is too low resulting in low to no photoconversion  Increase number of repetitions and/or bleach iterations. May need to   increase laser intensity.    37c  No fluorescent signal in the red channel  Laser intensity value is too high resulting in photobleaching ROI  Disregard ROI, decrease laser intensity, and select another ROI.    37c  Cell shrinking or swelling after photoconversion  Laser intensity too high resulting in phototoxicity  Disregard ROI, decrease laser intensity, and select another ROI.    37d  Low fluorescence in the red channel  Low photoconversion efficiency  Increase number of repetitions and/or bleach iterations. May need to   increase laser intensity.    44,45  Unable to degrade matrix  Enzyme concentration too low, inadequate incubation time  Increase enzyme concentration or incubation time. Agitate matrix with   pipette tip more frequently to encourage degradation.    47  Unable to degrade cell-cell junctions within spheroid  Enzyme volume or concentration too low, inadequate incubation time  Increase concentration, volume, or incubation time. Gently vortex to   encourage junction cleavage.    68  Number of cells recovered is higher than number of photoconverted cells  Off-target photoconversion due to inadequate ROI placement and/or   autofluorescence  Create a stricter ROI to ensure no off target or false positive   photoconversion of nearby cells. Some cell types emit autofluorescence,   ensure cytometer voltage settings are set to allow for enough separation   between those autofluorescent cells and those that were photoconverted.   Decrease laser intensity or time course on microscope to reduce off target   photoconversion.    68  Low cell viability post FACS  Inadequate sample preparation and/or maintenance  Keep cells on ice to slow intracellular metabolism and increase survival.   Avoid generating a dry pellet or air bubbles during processing. Air bubbles   may create a surface tension that is toxic to the cells. Avoid vigorous   vortexing and instead mix with gentle pipetting. If cell centrifugation is   necessary post FACS, apply low speeds (125 - 250 g RT).    72  Poor cell proliferation and propagation  Poor collection conditions; not enough cells; crucial growth factors not   present  Sort into culture media with at least 20% FBS to increase growth factors   and promote cell survival. Coat cultivation plates with protein to promote   cell adhesion. Plate cells on smaller surface area plate to facilitate cell -   cell communication to promote cell survival. As such, rBM provides a microenvironment conducive to collective invasion for many of our lung tumor cell lines (Fig. 2) (3, 4). Conversely, for our studies using the 4T1 murine model of breast cancer, we find that fibrillar type I collagen provides a microenvironment supportive of multicellular pack invasion for the largely e-cadherin positive 4T1 cells (data not shown).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B44EF480F3EF11ED8A7C23DA29EA808C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"BDA8C100F3EF11ED8A7C23DA29EA808C","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"5":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B96E2490F3EF11ED8A7C23DA29EA808C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"6":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"C675B6D0F3EF11ED8A7C23DA29EA808C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1798}},"7":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"D35B6930F3EF11ED8A7C23DA29EA808C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"8":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"D764E380F3EF11ED8A7C23DA29EA808C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"9":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E5A0B000F3EF11ED8A7C23DA29EA808C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qes8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"df2kj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7kdsd","text":"To generate spheroids, plate 3,000 H1299 cells in   (1.5 × 104 cells per mL) in a low adherence 96-well plate. Create 18 spheroids per condition to embed 10 – 12 spheroids in matrix. Excess spheroids are created to account for shape and stability deformities during incubation period for spheroid formation (Table 2). Steps 16 – 25    Cell adherence  Heterogeneous cells can express distinct adherence junction profiles to   regulate cell – cell junctions and cell – matrix adhesion/interactions.   Centrifugating 96-well plate places cells in the center of the well near one   another to promote cell – cell junction formation. Distinct ECMs are highly specialized and organized networks integrating a myriad of molecules that establish an essential architectural support structure for cells, tissues, and organs along with providing a substrate for cell adhesion and traction (2, 9). Various 3D in vitro systems utilize reconstituted ECMs to assess growth, motility, and invasive phenotypes.
